result.execSummary:
The defendant Maegan Mn Bauman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
Per Mary at ONSO - in custody at Oneida County
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

4:09 p.m. Court Commissioner John Hogan. Defendant Maegan Mn Bauman in court. Defendant states she is waiting for drug test to come back for either waitress or black jack dealer job at casino. Expects employment to begin within 2 weeks. Adj. 4:10 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
3:45 p.m. Defendant Maegan Mn Bauman in court. Defendant states she made a $45 payment today.  Adj. 3:47 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
4:05 p.m. Defendant Maegan Mn Bauman in court.  Defendant states she made payment - provides receipt to Court.  Review hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

4:27 p.m. Defendant Maegan Mn Bauman in court. Defendant states she has no money - has been employed since March of 2014 but has not been working much since last court date. Court orders defendant to begin making payments. Adj. 4:32 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

02:20 pm - Defendant Maegan Mn Bauman in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence 
Fine $379/DNA Surcharge $200
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:39 pm - Defendant Maegan Mn Bauman in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

02:18 pm - Defendant Maegan Mn Bauman in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
